law.catch_line: Cabinet to investigate status of children -- Report to Governor.

text.section: The cabinet shall make a survey of child welfare in the state and shall present to the Governor and Legislature, prior to each legislative session, a report of its findings and recommendations based thereon. The cabinet shall prepare data upon the subject and be ready at all times to advise the Governor or any member of the General Assembly concerning bills, relating to children, introduced at any session of the General Assembly.

The cabinet shall discover dependent, neglected, delinquent, and disabled children, and shall secure for them the benefits of law, and shall have general supervision and control over the administration of mothers' aid.

law.history: Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 405, sec. 53, effective July 15, 1994; and ch. 416, sec. 14, effective July 15, 1994. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 331L-7, 331L-8.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/15/94). This section was amended by 1994 Ky. Acts chs. 405 and 416 which are in conflict. Under KRS 446.250, Acts ch. 416, which was last enacted by the General Assembly, prevails.
